rules.name: go-error-handling
rules.description: Rules for consistent error handling in Go code

avoid.message: Avoid inline error checking. Separate the operation from its error check for better readability and debugging.
Avoid inline error checking with discarded values. Separate the operation from its error check.
Avoid ignoring errors. Either handle the error or explicitly document why it's safe to ignore.

prefer.message: Separate error checking from the operation for better readability and debugging.

correct:
value, err := someFunction()
if err != nil {

documentation.title: Go Error Handling Best Practices
documentation.description: Go error handling should be explicit and clear. Separating operations from their error checks improves code readability, debugging, and maintainability.

rules.name: nix-flake-devshell
rules.description: Guidelines for running commands in a Nix flake environment with devshell

avoid.message: Avoid direct package manager commands. Use the Nix devshell which provides all dependencies.
Avoid direct package installation. Use the Nix devshell which provides all dependencies.
Avoid running Go commands directly. Run them within the Nix devshell environment.
Run build tools within the Nix devshell environment for consistent dependencies.
Run sqlc within the Nix devshell environment for consistent dependencies.

prefer.message: Use 'nix develop' to enter the development environment defined in the flake.
Use 'nix develop -c <command>' to run commands within the Nix devshell context.

documentation.title: Working with Nix Flakes and Devshells
documentation.description: This codebase uses Nix flakes with a devshell to provide a consistent development environment. Always run ALL commands within this context, especially Go testing and code generation which require specific tool versions.

rules.name: database-migrations
rules.description: Guidelines for managing database schema changes through migrations

avoid.pattern: ALTER TABLE|CREATE TABLE|DROP TABLE|CREATE INDEX|DROP INDEX
avoid.message: Avoid direct SQL schema changes. Create a new migration file instead.

prefer.message: Create new migration files with sequential numbering and descriptive names.

incorrect: ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN email TEXT;
CREATE TABLE posts (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY);

documentation.title: Database Migration Best Practices
documentation.description: All database schema changes must be tracked through migration files. Create new migration files in the migrations directory with sequential numbering and descriptive names. Never modify existing migration files.
